summary: This document is the First Amendment to the Amendment and Restatement of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2014 Trust, detailing various amendments to the trust provisions, including bequests to specific individuals and conditions for those bequests. It outlines the roles of the Grantor and Trustees, as well as the distribution of assets upon the Grantor's death.

keyFacts: The trust agreement was amended to include specific bequests to various individuals.
Luciano A. Fontanilla, Jr. and Rosalyn Fontanilla are set to receive a bequest of $2,000,000 if at least one survives the Grantor.
Richard D. Kahn is set to receive a bequest of $5,000,000 if he survives the Grantor.
Michelle Fern Saipher is to receive $3,000,000 if she is married to Darren K. Indyke at the time of the Grantor's death.
The document outlines conditions under which beneficiaries may receive their bequests based on their employment status post-Grantor's death.
